intro: Knautia puberula, commonly known as the downy knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky habitats. Knautia puberula is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
